code:
# @param {Integer[]} nums
# @param {Integer} limit
# @return {Integer[]}
def lexicographically_smallest_array(nums, limit)
    n = nums.size
    sorted = nums.sort
    pos = Hash.new { |h, k| h[k] = [] }
    nums.each_with_index { |num, i| pos[num] << i }
    bit = Array.new(n + 1, 0)

    update = lambda do |i, val|
        i += 1
        while i <= n
            bit[i] += val
            i += i & -i
        end
    end

    sum = lambda do |i|
        res = 0
        i += 1
        while i > 0
            res += bit[i]
            i -= i & -i
        end
        res
    end

    for i in 0...n
        min_pos = n
        sorted.each do |num|
            break if num - nums[i] > limit
            next if pos[num].empty?
            min_pos = [min_pos, pos[num].first].min
            break if num >= nums[i]
        end
        if min_pos < n
            nums[i], nums[min_pos] = nums[min_pos], nums[i]
            update.call(pos[nums[min_pos]].shift, 1)
            pos[nums[i]].sort!
        end
        break if min_pos == n
    end
    nums
end
